TopicTitle: Kerbin continents and oceans. Has anyone bothered to name them?

Articles.Content:
Hi, just a thought - are there any 'official' names to Kerbin continents or oceans?

Edited December 23, 2014 by cicatrix
added a pic
I don't think so. But that piece of land just east of the desert biome there looks an awful lot like a smaller Africa.

maybe rowsdower could set up a community thing where we throw in suggestions and the best get picked and assigned by the other devs?

-Nasah

-Essa

-Ishro

-Raughskozmusk

just some Ideas ripped off from real space agency names.

Look at and install the Kerbinside mod. They have names for the mountains, certain geographic locations and such.

Edited December 23, 2014 by NeatCrown

Been done before, though not officially of course:

(I'll refrain from linking some of the sillier maps from when the forums had a roleplaying section, suffice it to say that there are reasons some people are tired of the letter K.)

I know Bontoros (sp?) that runs the long term Laythe mission named a lot of things on Laythe and it's great homage to LP'ers and other people.

I love the new official Sagan Sea from Laythe tho.

(I'll refrain from linking some of the sillier maps from when the forums had a roleplaying section, suffice it to say that there are reasons some people are tired of the letter K.)

This is why we can't have nice things:

This is why we can't have nice things:

I don't know what you could be talking about. I mean, one of those names didn't even have a "K" in it at all!
Sure looks like a single supercontinent to me. 'Course, some of our continent distinctions are rather arbitrary as well (I'm looking at you, Europe)

Back in early alpha (0.15 times) I saw kerfrica or related variants for the KSC continent (it's derived from 'Africa' and the prefix 'ker' as in kerbin and kerbol) being used quite a lot, probably the closest fan adoption of any phrase I can recall.
I've always called the continent containing KSC 'Kafrica' but I have never needed to name the other continents.
On a semi-related tidbit, There's an area on Titan that scientists have named 'Kraken Mare'.
Well, I've recently been calling the mountain range west of the KSC the Kamikaze Mountains, and the big desert the Genedrin Desert.

This falls in line with the fact that all the planets need to be fleshed out further. Both in creating more dynamic landscapes and labeling aspects of them. Perhaps with resources coming this will become a bit more apparent.

http://imgur.com/KF1ejoc

Well, i have a political map. My space agencies are centered around and UCKK, KKKP, and occasionally the EGU save. There are some purely made up countries, like all the EGU countries, but all the rest are references to real world countries.

[spoiler/ Analogs]

KKKP is soviet russia and new China combined, Haiquan is Taiwan, Kindenia is India, asteralia is Australia and Sealandia is the Oceana nations. Serachioa is Japan

EDIT: oops, spoilers arent working

Edited December 29, 2014 by Rolanvorxariat

I've always called the continent containing KSC 'Kafrica' but I have never needed to name the other continents.

Same here; it is so like Africa (complete with an Iberian peninsula above it) that no other name fits as well. But that landmass and the Crater Sea are the only regions I have semi-formally named.
:rolleyes:Some contracts is fly to locations, and the say like: Fly to krakens Gap or somthing like that, so we have some names for some locations, thats good right?...
I always thinkof the peninsula east of KSC Korea, but have never named anything else.

Since reading 'Duna, Ore Bust!', I can't help but think of Mount Whoopstooshort and Overshoot Island.

Happy landings!

I haven't named many land features or continents and those that I have named are pretty uninspired.

I call the home continent "Africa" and the next one west "India". The peninsula to the East is "Korea". There's also the Crater Basin and the Badlands crater.

Other than that I haven't named anything.

Best,

-Slashy

I've never gotten around to it, but I've always wanted to name all of kerbins seas and land masses myself. However, concerning other bodies, I often name a certain place after the kerbal who first visited it. E.G. Jebdiah crater, Bob's hill, Kurt Canyon, etc.

Someone in the forum posted this some time ago:

Found it the most compelling map if seen yet.
I call the smallest island in the Island runway chain 'Overshoot Isle' because it's the last thing many of my kerbals see when they overshoot KSC(Damn you KSP Water! Damn you!)
ya they have the sagen sea on laythe why not more?

ya they have the sagen sea on laythe why not more?

The fun biome names postdate the initial run of this (since resurrected) thread.
